intro: Psychotria yapoensis, commonly known as the Yapo psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance.
